title: Duriense VR
text:
Duriense is a <a href="Portuguese%20wine">Portuguese wine</a> region covering the same area as the <a href="Douro%20DOC">Douro DOC</a> and the <a href="Port%20wine">Port wine</a> region. In difference from Douro DOC, Duriense VR is a designation at the lower "<a href="Vinho%20Regional">Vinho Regional</a>" (VR) level, which corresponds to <a href="table%20wine">table wine</a>s with a geographical indication under <a href="European%20Union%20wine%20regulations">European Union wine regulations</a>, similar to a <a href="French%20%28wine%29">French</a> "<a href="vin%20de%20pays">vin de pays</a>" region. Thus, it is the simpler or less typical wines of the Douro region that are sold using a Duriense VR label.
Before the creation of a separate Duriense VR, the Douro vineyards were part of the former <a href="Tr%C3%A1s-os-Montes%20VR">Trás-os-Montes VR</a>, which is now called <a href="Transmontano%20VR">Transmontano VR</a> and no longer includes the Douro vineyards.
<a href="Donzelinho%20branco">Donzelinho branco</a> is one of the authorized grape permitted to be blended in the wines of Duriense.
